results.title: Lessons in living
results.creator_credit: Bill MacDonald, Edith Spencer, Dallas Jones Production and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The community of Lantzville, British Columbia, is a cross-section of nationalities and industrial groups - farmers, fishermen, lumbermen and railroad workers. Its spirit and its public school were down at the heels, but both community and school were transformed. An adjoining barn was converted into a community hall for the parents, to serve at the same time as a school gymnasium and as a workshop for the farm mechanics class. With the improved building, the whole school program was broadened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill MacDonald, Edith Spencer, Dallas Jones Production and ONF | NFB

results.title: Leslie's cube
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and MGM International Films
results.brief_description: The radiation of heat of various substances is illustrated with standard equipment. Hot water is poured into a cube adjacent to a horizontal thermometer. This cube has faces of different materials and each face is presented to the thermometer in turn. The resulting rates of rise and fall in temperature registered on the thermometer are noted.

results.title: Lesbian Vampires = Vampyros Lesbos
results.creator_credit: Jesus Franco, Karl Heinz Mannchen, Fenix Cooperative Cinematografica, Hispano-Allemande and Telecine
results.brief_description: Amidst psychedelic keyboard and sitar music comes the erotic horror story of a powerful lesbian vampire (Soledad Miranda). Linda (Ewa Stromberg), a lawyer, is having potent and erotic dreams that she can’t explain. Her work sends her to a small island where she meets the force behind her dreams and her life is taken over by the rule of the dark spirit world. Does she have the will to resist? Will her boyfriend and sympathetic psychiatrist get to her in time? A cult classic from the director of “Female Vampire”. Cast includes Susann Korda, Dennis Price, Paul Muller.

results.title: Les Miserables: Stage By Stage
results.creator_credit: John Caird, Trevor Nunn, Martin Cox and Telstar Independent Programs
results.brief_description: This film follows the development of the musical “Les Miserables” which has become a triumph the world over. When it opened in London in October 1985, at the Barbican Theatre, it opened to mixed reviews, but went on to silence the critics and is now one of the most successful musical shows of all time. “Les Miserables” is either in production or development in over seventy cities of the world. The success continues. A symphonic recording of the complete score is being released worldwide and a film version of the musical is in development. Using performance footage from the London, Oslo, Budapest and Viennese productions, this program celebrates this phenomenal success and discusses its progress with its writers, directors and producers.

results.title: Les Fleurs de macadam
results.creator_credit: Laurent Coderre, Rene Jodoin and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In this ink animated film, Jean-Pierre Ferland sings about the industrial workers of Montreal who are tied to the grind and grime of the city. Award: Yorkton

results.title: Les Beaux souvenirs
results.creator_credit: Francis Maikiewiez, Jean Dansereau and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A middle-class wife leaves her husband with two young daughters. Through a series of occasional flash-backs, a contrast is made between the seemingly happy family relationship when the girls were young and the shattered threesome in later years. Starring Monique Spaziani, Julie Vincent and Paul Herbert.

results.title: Leopold: the see-through crumbpicker (K)
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, William Bernal, Firebird Films and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Leopold is an invisible creature who creates havoc as he devours every crumb in sight. How his good friend Minerva renders him visible - and where he ends up when she does - is the amusing outcome of this action-filled tale. Based on the book written and illustrated by James Flora.

results.title: Leonardo. The Divine Michelangelo
results.creator_credit: Leslie Megahey, British Broadcasting Corporation and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: Two fascinating documentary television series about the most influential artists of the Italian Renaissance. The first disc contains three parts to the television series about Leonard da Vinci and his work/creations. Written and presented by Alan Yentob. Presented as docu-drama with actors playing the roles of Leonardo and his contemporaries in a costume-drama style setting, with mock interviews and commentaries to make what would otherwise be straightforward information be imparted in a most enlightening and educative/entertaining way. The second disc contains two parts to the television series about Michelangelo. Narrated by Susannah York. “Program One” is about his triumph of the statue of David and “Program Two” is about the painting of the Sistine Chapel and his architectural designs.

results.title: Leonardo Da Vinci: giant of the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A documentary on the artistic and scientific achievements of Leonardo da Vinci including detailed commentary on such works as the “Mona Lisa” and “The Last Supper”.
